issue.title: [C++] Implement unique kernel for dictionary type
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10403](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10403). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Calling the "unique" compute function on a ChunkedArray of dictionary type (as read by the CSV reader) errors with "Only hashing for data with equal dictionaries currently supported". But is it necessary to hash to get unique values from a dictionary type? The dictionary values are the unique values (for each chunk), they're already there.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10403?focusedCommentId=17317150) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 9683
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9683>
